result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse V. Bloom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim within 30 days and must be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.

Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Court calls case. No. 15CM69 and 16CM12.  Defendant Jesse V. Bloom in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered a no contest plea to an amended Ct. 1 charge of  Disorderly Conduct in 15CM69 and Ct. 2 in 16CM12.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea, found DE guilty.  15CM69 - On Ct. 1 Court imposed a fine of $263.50 and $67.00 victim witness fee.  Court dismissed but read in Ct. 2.  16CM12 - Count 2 Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 1 year with the following conditions: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to R.K., due within 30 days; counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.   Court dismissed but read in Ct. 1.  Sentence credit of 2 days. Court ordered payment plan of $25/mo. beginning 11-1-16. ba

Taylor County Arrest Report
of court proceeding

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse V. Bloom appeared in person, in custody.  Detective Aemus Balsis sworn and examined.  Court finds probable cause for arrest based on the detective's testimony.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $150.00 cash bond and a $350.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with R.K.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Court ordered the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings on defendant's other case. Next court date is march 8, 2016 at 1:00 pm - rt
